reviews.text: I had a very quick trip to this hotel - concur on the great location, amazing views etc. My room was an average size, but felt quite sparse, almost like a uni dorm. The staff were very helpful and quick to respond eg to requests for an iron. The breakfast was great - I would be the size of a house if I had croissants and cheese for breakfast every morning! Very good coffee too.
reviews.title: Great location, average room
3rd stay, not disappointed

reviews.title: Must stay

reviews.text: How can I convince people to stay at this hotel? Yes. It is a little out of the way. You have to take tram #3 from Central Station just past the art museum and then a little mountain railroad up the hill, which is great fun, and yes, it is not impressive from the outside, sort of Soviet Bloc architecture ... but inside, mmmmm! Super service, lovely rooms, beautiful views over the lake and downtown Zurich from high above which makes it magical at night. I go back each year just to sit on the balcony (each room has a private one) and watch the sunset. It is the end of my yearly sojourn in Europe and calms me down for the flight home. I usually go down to the Museum if I want to do anything at all, which takes all of ten minutes from the hotel, and avoid downtown ... I just rest, enjoy the pool, the view, the food and being taken care of ... then it is back to reality ... Manhattan.
reviews.title: Fantastic Placee to Stay

reviews.text: Whenever business takes me to Zurich, this is - and has been for over 20 years - my favourite place to spend the night. True, it is not right in the centre of town but rather pleasant to get to (tram plus funicular) and quiet (except for rooms where the last number is a 1). Very friendly staff, beautiful view over lake and mountains, the whole town lies at your feet. There is a free shuttle bus to the main railway station, but it does not run very frequently. I just love the breakfast. Large underground car park absolutely free. One minus point: The room furniture is hideous! But bed very comfortable and good lighting. TV set should be replaced by a flat screen one. Some rooms have airconditioning individually adjustable (not easy).
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Zurich

reviews.text: The Waldhaus Dolder is not to be confused with its recently-refurbished Grand neighbour up the hill!
reviews.title: A well-kept secret

reviews.text: When you reach it via the funicular from Roemerhof, you'll be greeted by something that looks hideous - 60s concrete. Fortunately, the interior, though relatively unflamboyant, is much, much more pleasant. Some of the rooms are small, but many are rather like suites, and the majority, though not all, have balconies and superb views down over Zurich.
reviews.title: Great views, average building
Step back to the 70s at the Dolder Waldhaus!
reviews.text: The food is good-quality Swiss, both at breakfast and dinner. Staff are also typical Swiss: efficient and with passable, though not always perfect, English (which is anyway far better than my Swiss-German!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is altogether a quiet haven from the city, and a few degrees cooler in a hot summer. I tend to stay there once every couple of years as an occasional change from my much more frequent venue. I can imagine it would be ideal for visitors to Zurich who appreciate peace and quiet (not that Zurich is a bustling metropolis!) and, perhaps, would like some walking in the woods.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the price
